definitions.definition: The common mineral iron disulfide (FeS 2 ), of a pale brass-yellow color and brilliant metallic luster, crystallizing in the isometric system.
Any metallic-looking sulphide, such as the above, which is the most common.
Any metal dichalcogenide that is isostructural to the common mineral.
examples: Copper diselenide can occur both as a marcasite and a pyrite .

main_definition: ( mineralogy ) The common mineral iron disulfide (FeS 2 ), of a pale brass-yellow color and brilliant metallic luster, crystallizing in the isometric system.
secondary_definitions: ( usually as a plural: pyrites ) Any metallic-looking sulphide, such as the above, which is the most common.
( solid state chemistry ) ( usually as a plural: pyrites ) Any metal dichalcogenide that is isostructural to the common mineral.
